title: 3D Printer Camp Group – Make One Now!
description: Do you want to build your own 3D Printer?

title: Pop-up books and paper circuits
description: Pop-up engineering is really fun and extremely satisfying – for adults and for kids. But how might we use electricity to change the idea of what “interactive” books can be? In this session, participants will create pop-up cards that use the affordances of our materials to really investigate how circuits can change the idea of what a book can be. We’ll also consider where soft circuits are going by looking at examples in toys and wearable technologies.

title: Creative Coding with Processing
description: This workshop will give you an introduction to the basic principles of creative coding with Processing. Processing is an open-source coding platform used by designers and developers to create interactive installations, data visualizations, software tools, and much much more.

title: Introduction to User Experience (UX)
description: What is User Experience?

title: Mobile Storytelling as a New Medium
description: Mobile Storytelling as a New Medium is the first installment of a 3 part series on creating narratives within in the framework of a app. This lecture is a survey of current artists and projects using the mobile platform to create innovative narrative forms (i.e: Christoph Niemann’s “Petting Zoo”,  David Benqué’s “The Infinite Adventure Machine”, Works from “Les Editions Volumiques” etc…).

title: ITP Mappathon: Content Making for Projection Mapping
description:
Step 1
 This week, we will learn how to make visual content using Modul8.
 We will use a png, a jpg and a movie files to make a moving image using Modul8. This method is a great tool to camp your idea.

title: C4 – Media, Interactivity & Audio for iOS
C4 – Media, Interactivity & Audio for iOS
Really Big Video Part 1
description: This session will introduce Big Building Mapping and Video Projection. I will begin by showing examples of site-specific and video mapping pieces and then we will map a real building using a spatial scan in Mad Mapper. For homework each camper will get a scan to work from and some tips on how to create giant projections. Part 2 of the session will allow campers to showcase their mapped work projected 3 stories tall on an actual building on broadway.

title: Hacking Higher Ed
description: Exciting innovation is happening in the area of higher education. This session will ask participants to look at ways to reinvent higher education to increase its accessibility and exceed the current quality of the experience. We will do a brief survey current experiments such as Udacity, Khan Academic, O’Reilly, Code Academy, Meetups, TED Talks, General Assembly, Hackerspaces.   Topics will talk about new way of thinking about Curriculum, Content,  Conversation, Motivations and Outcomes,  Community,  Physical Space,  Economics, Research to create new institutions for higher education.  These topics are based on the syllabus for this course http://itp.nyu.edu/~dbo3/hack-ed/

title: C4 – Media, Interactivity & Audio for iOS
ITP Mappathon: Projection Mapping with MadMapper
description:
Step 2
 This week, we will learn how to connect your visual content created from Modul8 to a projection mapping software, MadMapper.

title: Harvesting Defecͫ̑̑ͫͦ͗̔͆͂̍͌͗͌ͦ̈̑̔̐̔͢͢t̔s; in A̵̡bleton Live.
description: Thinking of destruction and glitch as a creative method, this workshop explores subversive methods of sound design and composition in Ableton Live.  A variety of techniques will be demonstrated and discussed. All levels of user are invited to join.

title: “Noticing” Workshop
description: This workshop teaches techniques and tools for noticing—seeing, hearing and comprehending something new. In a short series of exercises we’ll explore the observation process in an array of domains, from cognitive psychology to ethnography and drawing to data collection, with techniques for reaching that moment we all crave: when something unexpected and terrific bursts forward into consciousness. Participants will leave with their eyes wide open to the inspirations and complexity that surround us all and their minds full of techniques for learning more.

title: Rest Of You: Digital Edition
description: Life is what happens to you will you are busy doing other things.  You pay attention to a small part of your experience when it is the rest of you that is more important.  The Rest of You is a class about trying to get a better picture of those parts that you don’t pay attention to.  This session will zero in on one week of work in the Rest Of You class that tries to cull through your digital footprint to give you a more accurate picture of yourself and perhaps suggest some interventions to change the rest of you.    Here are some assignments from the digital week of this class http://itp.nyu.edu/~dbo3/roy/?cat=12

title: Guest Speaker: Clive Thompson – “the new literacies”
Jitter Workshop: Coding for Video Art
Faster Fashion – Rapid Prototyping and the Things We Wear
Intro to openFrameworks, part 2
description: Part 2 will cover:

title: Designing Interactive Experiences for Public Spaces
Revisiting the GSM shield
description: This is a make-up session from the other week.

title: Nudgeables Workshop
description: Sometimes we use secret codes to communicate with our friends, partners, or colleagues while in the company of a larger group of people: a nudge, a cough, a scratch of the nose; something that says “I’m thinking of you…”, “Save me from this conversation!”, or “Let’s get out of here!”.  What if our clothing could communicate these messages for us?

title: Tom Igoe Mystery Talk
Collaborative Mobile Design for International Development
description: The world has nearly as many cell phone subscriptions as inhabitants, and 75% of them are in the developing world, with Africa leading the way. As the majority of mobile phone users live in emerging markets and developing economies, how do we design collaboratively with their needs, cultures and dreams in mind? How can mobile phone apps change informal economies and what goes into design considerations? How can we work together to improve billions of lives?

title: Designing Projections for a Chamber Opera
description: I recently created video projections for “Lotus Lives,” a new independent one-hour opera written for two singers, a brass quintet, percussion, and audio-video playback. I tackled everything from content design and creation, through coordinating six projectors with a live performance on a limited budget, and making sure it ran smoothly.

title: Mobile Culture: How leading startups create and unleash mobile behavior
description: Learn how 3 top startups create mobile experiences around specific user groups, tapping into existing behavior and unleashing new one.

title: Building Websites with Twitter Bootstrap
description: Hi! This is a hands-on workshop where we are going to build a single page portfolio site with Twitter Bootstrap.

title: Really Big Video Part 2
description: In this session, campers will compile and project their work from the previous week onto a giant building on broadway using video mapping and one really big projector. Taught by Gabe BC

title: End-of-Camp Shindig
description: Half show & tell, half party, the End of Camp Shindig is an opportunity to celebrate the month we’ve spent together and share what we’ve created.
